Values for Socket types

Enum Constant Summary
DEALER
          A socket of type ZMQ_DEALER is an advanced pattern used for extending request/reply sockets.
PAIR
          A socket of type ZMQ_PAIR can only be connected to a single peer at any one time.
PUB
          A socket of type ZMQ_PUB is used by a publisher to distribute data.
PULL
          A socket of type ZMQ_PULL is used by a pipeline node to receive messages from upstream pipeline nodes.
PUSH
          A socket of type ZMQ_PUSH is used by a pipeline node to send messages to downstream pipeline nodes.
REP
          A socket of type ZMQ_REQ is used by a client to send requests to and receive replies from a service.
REQ
          A socket of type ZMQ_REP is used by a service to receive requests from and send replies to a client.
ROUTER
          A socket of type ZMQ_ROUTER is an advanced socket type used for extending request/reply sockets.
SUB
          A socket of type ZMQ_SUB is used by a subscriber to subscribe to data distributed by a publisher.
XPUB
          Same as ZMQ_PUB except that you can receive subscriptions from the peers in form of incoming messages.
XSUB
          Same as ZMQ_SUB except that you subscribe by sending subscription messages to the socket.

Enum Constant Detail

PAIR

public static final SocketType PAIR
A socket of type ZMQ_PAIR can only be connected to a single peer at any one time. No message routing or filtering is performed on messages sent over a ZMQ_PAIR socket.

PUB

public static final SocketType PUB
A socket of type ZMQ_PUB is used by a publisher to distribute data. Messages sent are distributed in a fan out fashion to all connected peers.

SUB

public static final SocketType SUB
A socket of type ZMQ_SUB is used by a subscriber to subscribe to data distributed by a publisher. Initially a ZMQ_SUB socket is not subscribed to any messages.

REQ

public static final SocketType REQ
A socket of type ZMQ_REP is used by a service to receive requests from and send replies to a client. This socket type allows only an alternating sequence of receive(request) and subsequent send(reply) calls.

REP

public static final SocketType REP
A socket of type ZMQ_REQ is used by a client to send requests to and receive replies from a service. This socket type allows only an alternating sequence of send(request) and subsequent receive(reply) calls.

DEALER

public static final SocketType DEALER
A socket of type ZMQ_DEALER is an advanced pattern used for extending request/reply sockets. Each message sent is round-robined among all connected peers, and each message received is fair-queued from all connected peers.

ROUTER

public static final SocketType ROUTER
A socket of type ZMQ_ROUTER is an advanced socket type used for extending request/reply sockets. When receiving messages a ZMQ_ROUTER socket shall prepend a message part containing the identity of the originating peer to the message before passing it to the application.

PULL

public static final SocketType PULL
A socket of type ZMQ_PULL is used by a pipeline node to receive messages from upstream pipeline nodes. Messages are fair-queued from among all connected upstream nodes.

PUSH

public static final SocketType PUSH
A socket of type ZMQ_PUSH is used by a pipeline node to send messages to downstream pipeline nodes. Messages are round-robined to all connected downstream nodes.

XPUB

public static final SocketType XPUB
Same as ZMQ_PUB except that you can receive subscriptions from the peers in form of incoming messages.

XSUB

public static final SocketType XSUB
Same as ZMQ_SUB except that you subscribe by sending subscription messages to the socket.
